headline: Automated WireGuard networks for distributed systems and Kubernetes
description: Netmaker is an open source virtual networking platform based on WireGuard. With Netmaker, you can bridge, clouds, the edge, IoT devices, and Kubernetes clusters. Netmaker provides the fastest possible virtual networks, with an average speed 10x faster than standard alternatives. Think of Netmaker like your VPC for distributed systems.

## How it works
Mesh VPN
Create Networks
Netmaker's multi-network design lets you create multiple, segmented virtual networks for different use cases, and manage them all in one place. B2B companies love being able to manage multiple customers from one account, while keeping their traffic segmented and secure.Or, separate by use case like secure internet access, edge device management, meshing cloud servers, and remote access to the office.
Node Management
Add Nodes
Add endpoints to your network with three different options for VPN clients:Install the **netclient** as a headless agent on Linux, Docker, Windows, or Mac, and create peer-to-peer nodes with powerful networking capabilities.Use simple WireGuard configuration files, and integrate and WireGuard-compatible device into your network, including Routers.Run the Remote Access Client on Desktop or Mobile devices, and provide a user-friendly remote access application to end users, complete with authentication and session expiry.
Traffic Routing & ACLs
Configure Traffic Flow
Set nodes as Hubs for traffic, to relay connections.Set nodes as Forwarders to external networks like the office, cloud, or internet, to provide remote access from from your VPN.Set ACLs on your network, to configure device-to-device permissions and implement a zero-trust architecture.
User Management
Grant Access
User Netmaker's user management system to onboard end users, assign roles and permissions and grant access to networks.Integrate with any OIDC-compliant auth provider, enable 2FA, or set rules on session expiry, so users only access the system the way you want them to.

### how to create a Software Defined Network with NETmaker
Log into the dashboard or CLI
Create networks and add hosts to them using the Netclient.
Tell Netmaker how your network should look with features like Egress, Ingress, Relays, ACL's, and more.
Netmaker sends this state to the Netclient agents running on your devices and servers.
The Netclient configures WireGuard and routing rules to match the desired end state.
Your distributed overlay network is now completely operational.
